description: The CompTIA Cloud+ Certification is designed for IT professionals tasked with supporting private and public cloud infrastructures that have at least a few years of experience in IT networking. More and more companies are deploying cloud services in addition to, or in place of, traditional server infrastructure. The Cloud+ certification covers all the underlying hardware technologies, software, and logistics of deploying the technology, is designed to provide a well-rounded foundational knowledge of cloud and virtualization technologies and works to certify and validate one’s knowledge in the area of cloud computing.
descriptionMD: The CompTIA Cloud+ Certification is designed for IT professionals tasked with supporting private and public cloud infrastructures that have at least a few years of experience in IT networking. More and more companies are deploying cloud services in addition to, or in place of, traditional server infrastructure. The Cloud+ certification covers all the underlying hardware technologies, software, and logistics of deploying the technology, is designed to provide a well-rounded foundational knowledge of cloud and virtualization technologies and works to certify and validate one’s knowledge in the area of cloud computing. __[Click here](https://itpro.tv/comptia-partnership) to get an exam voucher discount.__
name: CompTIA Cloud+
subtitle: Vendor-neutral cloud management

episodes.description: The CompTIA Cloud+ Certification is designed for IT professionals tasked with supporting private and public cloud infrastructures. More and more companies are deploying cloud services in addition to, or in place of, traditional server infrastructure. The Cloud+ certification is designed to provide a well-rounded foundational knowledge of cloud and virtualization technologies.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don kick off the Cloud+ series by explaining some foundational concepts and terms. They start by describing what a cloud service is as well as the ideas of accountability and responsibility. Then they explore the common cloud models which include Software as as Service(SaaS), Platform as a Service(PaaS), and Infrastructure as a Service(IaaS). Finally they look at some of the less common cloud services like CaaS, DaaS, and XaaS.
episodes.title: Cloud Services

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don discuss cloud delivery models, which is basically how the cloud services are provided to the end user. Here they explain the most common models, including Public, Private, Hybrid, and Community clouds. They also explore automation and orchestration which helps you plan complex operations and have the cloud system automatically deploy them.
episodes.title: Cloud Delivery Models

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don get you up to speed with some of the terminology and buzz-words/phrases that permeate in conversation pertaining to cloud services. Here they cover terms like Elasticity, Pay-as-you-grow, and Chargeback. They also define other terms such as Multitenancy, Cloud bursting, and Rapid Deployment.
episodes.title: Cloud Terminology

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don walk you through common cloud storage concepts. They discuss how cloud providers store your data as well as the benefits of using cloud storage. Then they define cloud storage characteristics, which introduce you to terms like BLOB(Binary Large OBject) and Identifiers, specifically Object ID and Metadata/Extended Metadata. Finally they cover Cloud Storage Security controls. This includes Access Control(permissions), Access Policies, and Replicas.
episodes.title: Object Storage Concepts

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don explore the typical virtualization infrastructure. They start off by discussing some of the benefits of virtualization such as elasticity, network isolation, and hardware consolidation. Then they explain the differences between the Type-II and Type-I hypervisors. Finally, they go over some virtual cloud components like virtual NICs, CPU, RAM, and storage.
episodes.title: Virtualization Infrastructure

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don introduce you to creating and working with virtual machines. They begin by going over the virtual hardware requirements for items like CPU and RAM. They explain the CPU's special characteristics with regards to virtualization for both AMD and Intel chips. They also show you how virtualization software allocates RAM for the guest Operating Systems.
episodes.title: Virtual Machines

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don continue working toward creating a virtual machine; this time picking up with networking and disk considerations. They start by explaining virtual networks and virtual switches. They show you the many ways which you can connect a VM to your actual network through bridging, NAT, and even VLAN assignment. Then they jump into virtual disks where they explain concepts like fixed vs. dynamic size, IDE/SATA/SCSI virtualization, and virtual Storage Area Networks(SAN).
episodes.title: Virtual Machines Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don finish their mini-series on virtual machines by taking all the previously discussed topics and actually creating a VM. They also explain and install the "guest tools" on the newly created VM, which expands the VM's capabilities and support. Now that they have a fully functional VM they explain how you can use it as a template to create clones for rapid, on-demand deployments.
episodes.title: Virtual Machines Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don explore some of the reasons and methods for migration in a virtual environment. They being by looking at motives that could necessitate a migration, reasons like testing, upgrading, and/or performance issues. Then they discuss some of the migration variations, including physical to virtual, virtual to virtual, and virtual to physical. Also covered are some of caveats and considerations that need to be addressed before migrating.
episodes.title: Migrating Systems

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don explain one of the most useful features of any virtualization platform and that is snapshots. They begin by explaining what a snapshot is and then show you how they can be used to quickly restore a VM to a specific point in time. Then they cover taking backups in a virtualized environment, looking at both image and file backups.
episodes.title: Snapshots and Backups

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don explain some of the foundational information that is needed when working with attached storage in a private cloud environment. They begin by going through the common attached storage solutions like Network Attached Storage(NAS), Direct Attached Storage(DAS), and Storage Area Networks(SAN). They also cover some of the protocols and media used to connect attached storage. This includes Fibre Channel Protocol(FPC), Fiber Channel over Internet Protocol(FPIC), and Fibre Channel over Ethernet.
episodes.title: Storage Configuration

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don go over the common storage media, or drives, that you will work with when using a Storage Area Network(SAN) device. First they explain the different disk types. This includes SSD, spinning, USB, and tape. Then they cover the different connectors and data transfer speed for SATA and SAS. Finally they discuss tiering which allows you to use a variety of drives while optimizing storage through policies.
episodes.title: Storage Media

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don take you through some of the common RAID levels employed in Storage Area Network(SAN) environments. They give you a detailed rundown on RAID levels 0, 1, 5, 6, 1+0, and 0+1. They then explain some of the different filesystems that you may encounter, like EXT, NTFS, and ZFS.
episodes.title: RAID and File Systems

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don take you through configuring a Storage Area Network(SAN) appliance. They explain the best practices and procedures for implementing a SAN and then jump into actually working with a SAN's interface. They show you how to create LUNs as well as security features like zoning and LUN masking.
episodes.title: SAN Configuration

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don review basic networking concepts.  They briefly describe the use of IP addresses and its breakdown.  Don takes time to describe the basics of classful and classless IP address spaces and the use of subnet masks.  The guys take a look at 2 examples:  1 of subnetting and 1 of supernetting.  They emphasize the need to understand why and when it use them.
episodes.title: Network Concepts

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Don continue describe the basic networking concepts of NAT and PAT.   They look briefly at the technology that allows for Private IP addresses to communicate with devices that have Public IP addresses.  They talk about the components involved and the use of port numbers to make it work.  They also take a look at specific port numbers that should be known.
episodes.title: Network Concepts Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Don discuss advanced networking concepts. They will introduce virtual local area networks(VLAN) and IEEE 802.1Q VLAN trunks. They look at bonding two or more switch ports through a technique call link aggregation. They explain some of the aspects of the network adapters needed in virtualization.
episodes.title: Advanced Networking

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Don take a look at different network optimization techniques. They will explore different network types such as wide area networks, local area networks and metropolitan area networks. They discuss different techniques to keep these network connection running efficiently and effectively like clustering, load balancing, compression and caching. They demonstrate tools like ping, nslookup, traceroute and ifconfig to troubleshooting network connections as well.
episodes.title: Networking Optimization

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Don will dive into monitoring resource utilization. They will look at the common resources that can effect performance such as CPU, RAM, disk I/O and network bandwidth. They talk about the methods that can be used to monitor these resources such as SNMP, WMI, IPMI and Syslog. They explore what administrators can use to set up alerting like setting up SMS messages, email messages and HTTP posts.
episodes.title: Monitoring Resources

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Don dive into resource allocation and discuss the primary resources needed in virtualization such as memory, processing power, storage and network bandwidth. They look at best practices when assigning memory like dynamic versus static memory allocation and CPU allocation.
episodes.title: Allocating Resources

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Don continue their discussion on resource allocation and the primary resources needed in virtualization such as memory, processing power, storage and network bandwidth. They explore best practices when provisioning storage for virtual machine as well as network communication best practices. They will talk about reservations, quotas and licensing in this episode.
episodes.title: Allocating Resources Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Don explore remote access technologies used to connect to cloud based virtual environments. They look at the difference between remotely connecting to a virtual machine host as well as a virtual machine guest. They will discuss topics like using Microsoft's Remote Desktop Protocol, SSH and VNC to manage the virtual environment.
episodes.title: Remote Access

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Don will examine security concepts that help to keep cloud-based solutions protected and available. They will discuss technologies like virtual private networks (VPNs), software-based and hardware based firewalls, de-militarized zones (DMZs) and audit logs.
episodes.title: Security Concepts

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Don continue their discussion on the security concepts that help to keep cloud-based solutions protected and available. They look at the common types of attacks like distributed denial-of-service, ping-of-death and ping floods scenarios. They also dive into the world of access control models ranging from role-based access control to single sign on (SSO).
episodes.title: Security Concepts Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Don continue their discussion on the security concepts that help to keep cloud-based solutions protected and available. They talk about encryption types that are used to protect data like AES, 3DES, RC4 and RC5. They will look at the different data states such as "data in transit" and "data at rest," and the security techniques used to secure these different data states.
episodes.title: Security Concepts Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Don discuss storage security. They look at topics like obfuscation,access controls lists (ACLs), users and host authentication through the challenge handshake authentcation protocol and log auditing.
episodes.title: Storage Security

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Don focus on the systems we use to access cloud based data. They introduce the viewers to the concept of system hardening like disabling administrative accounts, changing default usernames and passwords, installing antivirus, patches and implementing host-based firewalls.
episodes.title: System Hardening

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Don take a look at the policies and procedure concepts to manage information technology based businesses. They discuss common concepts such as asset management, asset accountability and IP address management. They will dive into the realm of capacity management and help to differentiate asset management from capacity management.
episodes.title: Policies and Procedures

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Don continue their discussion on policies and procedures. They move into configuration management and change management. The introduce concepts such as change requests, cange advisory boards. They will look at life cycle managment and the five step process defined by the information lifecycle management and practical lifecycle management.
episodes.title: Policies and Procedures Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Don talk about the concepts that drive performance. They look at disk performance and disk-related concepts such as IOPS, reads vs. writes, metadata performance and caching. They demonstrate networking concepts like bandwidth, throughput, latency, jumbo frames, multipathing and load balancing. They will also explain scaling topics such as scaling vertically, horizontally and diagonally.
episodes.title: Performance Concepts

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Don explore the techniques that can be used to optimize performance. They talk about the best practices that can be followed to maintain optimal performance like performance baselining, vendor-specific tools as well third party management tools.
episodes.title: Optimizing Performance

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Don continue their discussion on performance optimization. They look at disk optimization and such topics as disk tuning, disk latency, I/O tuning, I/O throttling. They will also explore common disk problems such as disk and host bus adapter
episodes.title: Optimizing Performance Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Don continue their discussion on performance optimization. They look at memory performance and the techniques to optimizes memory. They demonstrate concepts such as memory failure, oversubscription and memory ballooning. With networking being a major dependency of cloud computing, Wes and Don will dive into network performance topic like NIC failure, replication, latency and load balancing. They explain common CPU concepts like virtual CPU count and hyperthreading as well as monitoring service performance.
episodes.title: Optimizing Performance Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Don explore concepts related to maintaining business continuity through disaster recovery. They look at recovery time objective, recovery point objective mean time between failure and mean time to repair. They identify redundency and fault tolerance techniques such as high availability,local clustering and geolocation.
episodes.title: Disaster Recovery

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Don continue their discussion on disaster recovery. They will explain the difference between hot,warm and cold sites. They will differeniate between failover, failback, geographical diversity, replication and multipathing.
episodes.title: Disaster Recovery Part 2
